Package org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.scan.v3

Provides the "version 3" scan framework (which can also be thought of as EVF version 2).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BaseScanTest.ReaderCreator
    Fixture that creates the reader and gives a test access to the reader.
    ManagedReader
    Extended version of a record reader which uses a size-aware batch mutator.
    ReaderFactory<T extends SchemaNegotiator>
    Creates a batch reader on demand.
    ScanLifecycleBuilder.SchemaValidator  
    SchemaNegotiator
    Negotiates the table schema with the scanner framework and provides context information for the reader.

    FixedReceiver.Builder

    ScanFixture.ScanFixtureBuilder
    Wraps a scan lifecycle builder to build the scan fixture.
    ScanLifecycleBuilder

    ScanLifecycleBuilder.DummyReaderFactory  
    TestFixedReceiver  
    TestScanBasics
    Tests the basics of the scan operator protocol: error conditions, etc.
    TestScanEarlySchema
    Test "early schema" readers: those that can declare a schema at open time.
    TestScanLateSchema
    Test "late schema" readers: those like JSON that discover their schema as they read data.
    TestScanOuputSchema
    Test the addition of an output schema to a reader.
    TestScanOverflow
    Test vector overflow in the context of the scan operator.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ManagedReader.EarlyEofException
    Exception thrown from the constructor if the data source is empty and can produce no data or schema.

Package org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.scan.v3 Description

Provides the "version 3" scan framework (which can also be thought of as EVF version 2). This version provides basically the same API as version 2, but with an implementation driven by schema rather than vectors.

Build a scan using the ScanLifecycleBuilder. Provide a subclass of ReaderFactory that will create each of your ManagedReader instances as needed. The framework handles the details of schemas, missing columns, implicit columns and the rest.
